Bootcamps.Bootcamp05.edu.monash.fit2099.vehicles

Class SportCar

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bootcamps.Bootcamp05.edu.monash.fit2099.vehicles.Vehicle
      • Bootcamps.Bootcamp05.edu.monash.fit2099.vehicles.SportCar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaxableVehicle

    public class SportCar
extends Vehicle
implements TaxableVehicle
    The SportCar class handles the creation, characteristics and behaviour of all sport cars present in the car auction. It represents a generic sport car, and extends the vehicle class as it a type of vehicle. This is version 5 of this class, as it is from Week 5's Bootcamp.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SportCar

        public SportCar(int vehicleId,
                java.lang.String make,
                java.lang.String model,
                int modelYear,
                int seats,
                java.lang.Boolean isConvertible)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        The SportCar contructor creates a new instance of a SportCar.
        Parameters:
        vehicleId - the sport car id number.
        make - the maker of the sport car.
        model - the model of the sport car.
        modelYear - the model year of the sport car.
        seats - the number of seats of the sport car.
        isConvertible - the "is convertible" status of the sport car (true = is convertible, false = is not convertible).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when it's super class: Vehicle throws and exception due to incorrect maker, model, or modelYear, or this constructor throws an exception due to incorrect seats number.

      • setSeats

        public boolean setSeats(int seats)
        Getter for the number of seats of the sport car.
        Parameters:
        seats - the number of seats of the sport car, where seats must be within 2 to 5.
        Returns:
        true if correct number of seats, false otherwise.
